intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pannosum subsp. euboeum, commonly known as the Euboean hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils, often in southern Europe. The plant features a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. This subspecies is part of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads.
